question: So you want me to tell you the story of my life...
answer: That's what I do. I interview people. I collect lives. F.M. radio. F.F.R.C. I just interviewed a genuine hero, a cop who -

question: You'd have to have a lot of tape for my story. I've had a very unusual life.
answer: So much the better. I've got a pocket full of tapes.

question: You followed me here, didn't you?
answer: Saw you in the street outside. You seemed interesting. Is this where you live?

question: It's just a room...
answer: So shall we begin? What do you do?

question: I'm a vampire.
answer: See? I knew you were interesting. You mean this literally, I take it?

question: Absolutely. I was watching you watching me. I was waiting for you in that alleyway. And then you began to speak.
answer: Well, what a lucky break for me.

question: Perhaps lucky for both of us. I'll tell you my story. All of it. I'd like to do that very much.
answer: You were going to kill me? Drink my blood?

question: Yes but you needn't worry about that now. Things change.
answer: You believe this, don't you? That you're a vampire? You really think...

question: We can't begin this way. Let me turn on the light.
answer: But I thought vampires didn't like the light.

question: We love it. I only wanted to prepare you.
answer: Good God!

question: Don't be frightened. I want this opportunity.
answer: How did you do that?

question: The same way you do it. A series of simple gestures. Only I moved too fast for you to see. I'm flesh and blood, you see. But not human. I haven't been human for two hundred years. What can I do to put you at ease? Shall we begin like David Copperfield? I am born, I grow up. Or shall we begin when I was born to darkness, as I call it. That's really where we should start, don't you think?
answer: You're not lying to me, are you?

question: Why should I lie? 1791 was the year it happened. I was twenty-four - younger than you are now.
answer: Yes.

question: But times were different then. I was a man at that age. The master of a large plantation just south of New Orleans... I had just lost my wife in childbirth. She and the infant had been buried less than half a year. I was twenty-four and life seemed finished. I couldn't bear the pain of their loss. I longed for a release from it. I wanted to lose everything. My wealth, my estate, my sanity. But Lady Luck didn't oblige. You're calling me a cheat? Then do me a favor. Get rid of this piece of shit... You lack the courage of your convictions, sir. Do it. Most of all I longed for death. I know that now. I invited it, a release from the pain of living... My invitation was open to anyone. Sailors, thieves, whores and slaves... But it was a vampire that accepted.
answer: They would have killed you -

question: Then my luck would have changed.
answer: You want death? Is it death you want?

question: Yes...
answer: Floats higher, with Louis in his arms, draining his blood. One hand reaches out and grips a rope, hanging from a shipmast. The other holds Louis. He withdraws his teeth, and looks into Louis' drained face. You still want death? Or have you tasted it enough?

question: No. The Gift of Darkness requires more than that, as you'll see. He left me half dead that morning. he wanted something from me. He came back the following night. Who the hell are you? What are you doing in my house?
answer: And a beautiful house it is too. Yours is a good life, isn't it? You're not afraid of anything, are you?

question: Why should I be?
answer: Are you going to put that through me too? Ruin my beautiful clothes? Were all last night's promises for nothing?

question: What do you want from me?
answer: I've come to answer your prayers. You want to die, don't you? Life has no meaning anymore, does it? The wine has no taste. The food sickens you. There seems no reason for any of it, does there? But what if I could give it back to you? Pluck out the pain and give you another life? And it would be for all time? And sickness and death could never touch you again? Vampires, that's what we are. Creatures of darkness, only we see it that darkness more clearly than any mortal has ever seen... Wouldn't it be sweet to bid pain goodbye? To wave away anguish and grief? To embrace the peace of the unending night?

question: Diane!!!!
answer: They are gone, Louis. Death took them. Death which you can now destroy...

question: NO!!!!!
answer: You have to ask me for this. You have to want it, do you hear me?

question: Give it to me!!!
answer: Vampires. We thrive on blood.

question: I want it!
answer: Tomorrow night. You must prove yourself. I will give you the choice I never had. The sun's coming up. Watch it carefully. If you come with me tomorrow, you'll never see it again.

question: My last sunrise. That morning I was not yet a vampire, and I saw my last sunrise. I remember it completely, yet I don't remember any sunrise before it. I watched the whole magnificence of the dawn for the last time, as if it were the first. And the I said goodbye to sunlight and went out to become what I became.
answer: Your grief has unhinged you. You've let your estate rot. You let your overseer run riot, work your slaves to the bone. We'll start with him.

question: How do you mean, start?
answer: Call him.

question: Carlos!!!
answer: Why the bloody whip, Carlos? Let's call that a start.

question: I can't do it.
answer: You've just done it -

question: Kill me if you will, but I can't do this...
answer: Sitting collected at the head of the steps.

question: Backs away as Lestat rises and descends the steps so fluidly he hardly seems to move.
answer: Don't worry. He was white trash, they come at two a penny. I dumped him in the swamp and untied the slave, licked his wounds clean.

question: You're the devil, aren't you? That's who you are.
answer: I wish I were. But if I were, what would I want with you?

question: I can't go through with it, I tell you.
answer: Your perfect. Your bitter and you're strong.

question: But why do you want me?
answer: Because you're as strong as I was when I was alive. You really want to be with them?

question: Yes. Kill me. Kill me like you promised -
answer: You asked for death. I didn't promise it - It's not your wife and child my friend. It's death. Just that simple. Think and choose. It happens to everyone. Except us. We shall be this way always, my friend. Young as we are now. I'm lonely for a companion, lonely for your strength. But I'm not that lonely. Do you want to come or not?

question: Yes...
answer: Did I hear a yes?

question: Yes...
answer: I've drained you to the point of death. If you drink from me you live for ever. If I leave you here you die.

question: No. Don't leave me here. Give it to me.
answer: You're sure?

question: Sure...
answer: Stop staring at my buttons. Didn't I tell you it was going to be fun? You're body's dying. Pay no attention. It will take twenty minutes at most.

question: Dying?
answer: It happens to us all. Come, you're going to feed now.

question: I want a woman.
answer: That doesn't matter anymore, Louis. You'll see. Come... They're all beautiful now. Men, women, the old, the young...simply because they are alive. - Take him.

question: The crucifix -
answer: Forget the crucifix. Take him. Resist no more Louis. Feed...

question: What have I done?
answer: You have fed. You were made for this...

question: Dear God, what have I done?
answer: You've killed Louis. And enjoyed it.

question: Dear God, what have I become????
answer: You said the slave had a crucifix...

question: Oh, that rumor about crosses?
answer: You can't look at them...

question: Nonsense, my friend. I can look on anything I like. And I am particularly fond of looking on crucifixes.
answer: The story about stakes through the heart?

question: The same. As you would say today... Bull shit.
answer: What about coffins?

question: Coffins... coffins unfortunately are a necessity... Killing is no ordinary act. It is the experience of another's life for certain. That night I had lost my own life and taken another's. I was drowning in a sea of human guilt and regret, with all the heightened senses of a vampire...
answer: Yes, that's you, my handsome friend. And you'll look that way till the stars fall from heaven.

question: It can't be...
answer: Give it time. You're like a man who loses a limb and still imagines he feels pain. It will pass. And we must sleep now. I can feel the sun approaching. You must get into it. It's the only safe place for you when the light comes.

question: And if I don't?
answer: The sun will destroy the blood I've given you. Every tissue, every vein. The fire in this lantern could do that too. Don't be afraid. In moments you'll be sleeping as soundly as you ever slept. And when you awake I'll be waiting for you, and so will all the world.

question: You told me something earlier. You said you didn't have a choice. Was that true?
answer: Someday I'll tell you. We have a lot of time to talk to each other. You might say... we have all the time we shall ever need.

question: Dear God, what have I done? I awoke the next evening to a different world. And I realized there are as profound differences between vampires as between human beings...
answer: Your wealth, dear Louis, is inestimable. Your income from cotton alone will keep us in comfort for a century.

question: I sat there staring at him with contempt. He had the soul of a shopkeeper, he was the sow's ear out of which nothing fine could be made. I felt sadly cheated in having him as a teacher...
answer: You'll get used to killing. Just forget about that mortal coil. You'll become accustomed to things all too quickly.

question: Do you think so?
answer: Au contraire, my dear. He could eat a horse...

question: I looked at anything mortal and saw all life as precious, condemning all fruitless guilt and passion that would let it slip through the fingers like sand... It was only as a vampire that I could see Yvette's beauty. Her fear of me increased my desire. I will finish it, Yvette. Now leave us.
answer: Can't you pretend, you fool? Don't give the game away. We're lucky to have such a home. Pretend to drink, at least. Such fine crystal shouldn't go to waste... I know. It gets cold so fast.

question: We can live like this? Off the blood of animals?
answer: I wouldn't call it living. I'd call it surviving. A useful trick if you're caught for a month on a ship at sea. There's nothing in the world now that doesn't hold some...

question: Fascination...
answer: Yes. And I'm bored with this prattle -

question: But we can live without taking human life. It's possible.
answer: Anything is possible. But just try it for a week. Come into New Orleans and let me show you some real sport!

question: This was New Orleans, a magical and magnificent place to live. In which a vampire, richly dressed might attract no more notice in the evening than hundreds of other exotic creatures.
answer: You think so, cherie? But what if I'd rather taste your lips? Let's get out of here!

question: Have you ever been caught?
answer: Of course not. It's so easy you almost feel sorry for them.

question: Lestat killed two, sometimes three a night. A fresh young girl, that was his favorite for the first of the evening. But the triumphant kill of Lestat was a young man. They represented the greatest loss to Lestat because they stood on the threshold of the maximum possibility of life.
answer: The trick is not to think about it. See that one? The widow St. Clair? she had that gorgeous young fop murder her husband. She's perfect for you. Go ahead.

question: But how do you know?
answer: Read her thoughts.

question: I can't.
answer: The dark gift is different for each of us. But one thing is true of everyone. We grow stronger as we go along. Take my word for it. She blamed a slave for his murder. And do you know what they did to him? The evildoers are easier. And they taste better... You whining coward of a vampire who prowls the night killing rats and poodles. You could have finished us both!

question: What have you done to me? You've condemned me to hell.
answer: I don't know any hell -

question: You want to see me kill? Watch me kill you then -
answer: What strength, my friend, what strength. I remember why I chose you now. But you can't kill me, Louis. Nor I you. Feed on what you want, mon cherie. Rats, chickens, doves, goats. I'll leave you to it and watch you come round. Just remember, life without me would be even more unbearable...

question: Being a vampire to him meant revenge. Revenge against life- itself. Every time he took a life it was revenge. and the slaves with a wisdom that was denied their masters, began to notice...
answer: Consider yourself lucky. In Paris a vampire has to be clever for many reasons. Here all one needs is a pair of fangs.

question: Paris? You came from Paris?
answer: As did the one who made me.

question: Tell me about him. You must have learnt something from him! It had to happen for you as it did for me!
answer: I learnt absolutely nothing. I wasn't give a choice, remember?

question: But you must know something about the meaning of it all, you must know where we come from, why we...
answer: Why? Why should I know these things? Do you know them? That noise! It's driving me mad! We've been in the country for weeks, with nothing but that noise!!!

question: They know about us. They see us dine on empty plates and drink from empty glasses.
answer: Come the New Orleans then. There's an opera on tonight. A real french opera! We can dine in splendor!

question: I respect life, don't you see? For each and every human life I have respect.
answer: Respect me a little then. I'm the only life you know. You'll soon run out of chickens, Louis...

question: No, ma cher. I need no supper. Is all well at Pointe Du Lac tonight? Leave me alone now, Yvette. I am frightened of myself, Yvette. Hush, Yvette - This place is cursed. Damned, do you hear me? And your master is the devil. Get out while you can. You're free men. Unlike me, you are no free men... Do I have to convince you?
answer: You fool, what have you done?

question: What you wouldn't do. It's almost sunrise. It will be the sun or the fire. You said they can kill me. The sun or the fire! Where are we?
answer: Where do you think, my idiot friend? We're in a nice filthy cemetery. Does this make you happy? Is this fitting and proper enough?

question: We belong in hell.
answer: And what if there is no hell, or they don't want us there? Ever think of that?

question: I was human then. Might as well ask can an angel feel love. Both are blesses or cursed with a certain... detachment. Though whether angels take as long to learn it as I, I will never know. Yes, I loved Yvette. As I loved Pointe Du Lac. And as with each thing I loved, I destroyed it. Lestat I did not love. And he survived.
answer: Not always... Your friend has no head for wine. Do you think so? Ah, but the price is pretty high. Your sweet friend - I exhausted her.

question: I'm leaving you. I can't stand this any longer.
answer: What, no flowery speeches? About what a monster I am? What a vulgar fiend?

question: I'm not interested in you. You disgust me. I'm interested in my own nature and know I can't trust you to tell me the truth about me.
answer: What do you imagine you are Louis?

question: I don't pretend to know.
answer: Don't you understand, Louis, that you alone of all creatures can see death with impunity... you alone under the rising moon can strike like the hand of God.

question: Lestat, she's alive!!!
answer: Vampires are killers. Predators, who's all seeing eyes were meant to give them detachment.

question: The girl, Lestat -
answer: I know. Let her alone. You think you can be human. You think you can go back. But you can't. You live off the blood of rats now Louis. How human is that? Lie still, love... You're tired love, you want to sleep.

question: Why do you do this Lestat?
answer: I like to do it. I enjoy it. Take you aesthete's taste to purer things. Kill them swiftly if you will, but do it! For now doubt, you are a killer Louis. Ah! Of course it's a coffin. You're dead, love.

question: Lestat - finish this -
answer: You finish her - if you feel so much - But it's too late, love. Look at your wrist, you breast. Unless I make her one of us...

question: NO!!!
answer: THEN YOU KILL HER!!!!!

question: My God... to think you... are all I have to learn from...
answer: In the old world, they called it the dark gift, Louis. And I gave it to you.

question: And if I am damned, why do I fell such pity for her gaunt face? Why do I wish to warm her tiny arms? Comfort her beating heart?
answer: Ah, my philosopher, my martyr. "Never take a human life". Well you must admit it is funny. Or is it merely touching? I'm not sure. Let's make some party of it, shall we? Maybe there's some life in the old lady yet? Come back, Louis, you are what you are. The plague would have got her within hours anyway. Merciful Death how you love your precious guilt.

question: For years I had not savored a human. And when I had Lestat's words made sense to me. I knew peace only when I killed and when I heard her heart in that terrible rhythm I knew again what peace could be. Yet even then I could not contenance it...
answer: All I need to find you Louis is follow the corpses of rats. Pain is terrible for you. You feel it like no other creature because you are a vampire. You don't want it to go on.

question: No...
answer: Do what it is in your nature to do. And you will feel as you felt with that child in your arms.

question: Oh God Lestat. I felt peace. I felt an end to the craving.
answer: That and more. Evil is a point of view. God kills, indiscriminately, and so shall we. For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like him as ourselves.

question: Is God merciless? Greedy and cruel?
answer: Ah, but we have even more in common with our creator. come, I am like a mother tonight. I want a child. She's here, your wounded one.

question: What are you saying?
answer: You need company, Louis. More congenial than mine...

question: Lestat!
answer: You remember how you wanted her, the taste of her -

question: I didn't want to kill her.
answer: Don't worry, Louis, you're conscience is clear. You left her alive. Claudia, Claudia, listen to me. You're ill, my precious and I'm going to give you what you need to get well.

question: Lestat, what do you mean?
answer: That's it dear. More. You must drink it to get well. Stop, that's enough. No more.

question: That's enough, cherie. Stop before the heart stops.
answer: I want some more.

question: It's bet in the beginning, lest the death takes you down with it. yes, that's it. My child. My beloved child.
answer: Where is Mamma?

question: September 21st, one hour after sunset. The sky is still violet, the way Louis loves and as always Lestat was gone when we rose.
answer: How did you learn to write, Claudia?

question: The way I learn everything. By watching you. But you never let me see you kill, Louis.
answer: Lestat taught you all you need to know about that.

question: Infant death, he calls me. Sweet daughter death. You know what he calls you? Merciful death.
answer: He jests.

question: Why does he call you that?
answer: Hush, Claudia don't talk about such things. Show me your book. Claudia! You did that?

question: Sit still. It's not finished -
answer: Time can pass fast for mortals when they're happy. With us it was the same. It was a very different life. And a new century was beginning. what had once been a small godforsaken French colony was growing into a great port, giving us an endless train of magnificent strangers... All human life was here, for the taking. And we took, all three of us, in our different ways...

question: Circles the troupe. She comes to a small tent, behind it. At the entrance stands a midget youth. She's like me, Louis. Small and yet not small at all. Like me.
answer: I watched her grow yet stay the same, her doll-like face possessed of adult eyes, eerie, powerful, seductive...

question: Another doll? I have ten, you realize.
answer: Well, I thought you could use another.

question: Why always on this night?
answer: What night? What do you mean?

question: You always give me the doll on the same night of the year.
answer: I didn't realize.

question: Is this my birthday?
answer: Some of these are so old and tattered. You should throw them away.

question: I have. Or there would be twice as many.
answer: But you're the fairest by far.

question: Why not? Can't I change, like everybody else? Which of you did it? Which of you made me the way I am?
answer: What you are? You would be something other than you are?

question: And if I cut my hair again?
answer: It will grow back again!

question: You made us what we are, didn't you?
answer: Stop her Louis!

question: DID YOU DO IT TO ME???? How did you do it?
answer: And why should I tell you? It's in my power.

question: Why yours alone? Tell me how it was done!!!!
answer: Be glad I made you what you are! You'd be dead not if I hadn't.

question: We're immortal. You've always known that.
answer: Tell me why... you've got to tell me...

question: You see the old woman? That will never happen to you. You'll never grow old. You will never die.
answer: And it means something else too, doesn't it? I shall never, ever grow up. I hate him. But I cannot bear to lose you. You're the only companion I have, forever. You taught me everything I know. Please tell me Louis. Tell me how it came to be that I am this... thing...

question: Come... I've something to show you... Though everything was changed, through the years had warped the contours of the streets, I found my way there, aware that I'd always known where it was and avoided it, not wanting to pass the doorway where I'd first heard Claudia cry. I heard you crying. You were there in a room with your mother. You were hugging her for warmth, crying pitifully as you had been for days. Because your mother was dead... I opened the shutters... I came into the room... I felt pity for you. Pity, but something else.
answer: You... fed on me?

question: And he found me with you. I ran, sickened at what I'd done. Then he cut his wrist and fed you from him. I tried to stop him, but you were a vampire then. And have been every night hereafter.
answer: You both did it?

question: I took your life. He gave you another one.
answer: And here it is. And I hate you both.

question: Where would she have gone? She was a child, and beautiful, heartbreaking merciless child. And I had made her that... I walked all night. I walked as I walked years before when my mind swam with guilt at the thought of killing. I found myself at the Cathedral. I thought of all the things I had done and couldn't undo. And I longed for one second's peace... I had no fear. If anything I longed for something to happen, for the stones to tremble as I entered the foyer. I almost genuflected from old habit. I almost prayed. And then it struck me. What if the statues gave an image to nothing? What if I was the supernatural in this cathedral? The only immortal under this roof. And I felt nothing but loneliness. Loneliness to the point of madness. It's too late, too late - Bless me father for I have sinned so often and so long, I don't know how to change nor beg for forgiveness. Murders, father, death after death. The woman who died two nights ago in Jackson Square, I killed her. And thousands of others before her. I have walked the streets of New Orleans like the Grim reaper. And fed on human life for my own. I am a vampire, father, and have turned the one I love most of all into on too - Then there is no mercy. You talk of sacrilege. Why if God exists does he suffer me to exist? Why does he suffer me to live?
answer: Locked together in hatred - But I can't hate you Louis. Is this the aroma of a mortal child? Louis. Lover. I was mortal to you. You gave me your immortal kiss. You became my mother and my father. And so I'm yours. Forever. But now's the time to end it, Louis. Now's the time to leave him.

question: He'll never let us go.
answer: Oh... really?

question: What is it now? You irritate me! Your very presence irritates me!
answer: Does it?

question: Yes. And I'll tell you something else! I've met someone who will make a better vampire than both of you.
answer: Is that supposed to frighten me?

question: You're spoilt because you're an only child. You need a brother. Or I do. I'm weary of you both.
answer: I suppose we could people the world with vampires, the three of us.

question: Not you my dear.
answer: You're a liar. But you upset my plans.

question: What plans?
answer: I came to make peace with you, even if you're the father of lies. I want things to be as they were.

question: Stop pestering me then!
answer: Oh, Lestat. I must do more than that. I've brought a present for you.

question: Then I hope its a beautiful woman with endowments you will never possess.
answer: Better than that. You haven't fed enough. I can tell by your color.

question: Oh, Claudia, you've outdone yourself. Where did you find them?
answer: Drunk on brandy wine. A thimbleful. I thought of you when I saw them.

question: We forgive each other then? Absinthe? You gave them absinthe?
answer: No. Laudanum.

question: Laudanum!
answer: Yes. It killed them, unfortunately. But it keeps the blood warm.

question: Ah Louis, Louis, she killed them... and let me drink...
answer: Don't Louis -

question: Louis, put me in my coffin...
answer: I'll put you in your coffin. Forever.

question: What have you done, Claudia -
answer: Louis! Look what's happening to him!!

question: Lestat. Oh, God forgive us.
answer: Don't mock me, Louis. Help me. Goodnight, sweet prince, may flights of devils wing you to your rest.

question: He's dead, Claudia, dead.
answer: The one good lesson he taught me, Louis. Never drink from the dead. Help me. We must get rid of him. Should we burn him? Bury him? What would he have liked, Louis?

question: Don't mock, Claudia...
answer: The swamp... In Europe, Louis. We shall meet our own kind. Find the one who made him. Learn what it means.

question: And suppose the one who made him knows nothing and the vampire who made him knows nothing, and it goes back, nothing proceeding from nothing, until there is nothing! And we must live with the knowledge that there is no knowledge. And if we find the one who made him? Do we tell him we destroyed his own creation? The vampire Lestat?
answer: He belongs with those reptiles, Louis. He deserved to die.

question: Then maybe so do we. Every night of our lives. He was my brother. My maker. He gave me this life, whatever it is.
answer: I did it for us, Louis. So we could be free. Louis, look at me.

question: I can't. Go away from me. Claudia - You're crying -
answer: You never talked to me like that - in all these years.

question: And you never cried -
answer: I can't bear it when you do - I would die rather than lose you Louis. I would die the way he died.

question: Hush, Claudia, hush now my dear -
answer: Tell me you don't hate me Louis. I did it for you -

question: I love you Claudia. Always. And we are free now, Claudia. No Lestat. Just the two of us, beginning the great adventure of our lives. The birds. We forgot about the birds. There's nothing for it but to let them go.
answer: What was that?

question: The workmen must have a trunk - don't stop, cherie -
answer: Louis!!! Reaches the stairs. She screams - Don't Louis -

question: We saw the Acropolis by moonlight, shades of grey and silver. And I longed for the brilliant white of those marbles in the hot sun of Homer... We docked at Varna and searched the rural countryside of the Carpathians, for what she liked to term "our kind"... The quest for these Old World vampires filled me with bitterness. We searched village after village, ruin after ruin and I was glad when always we found nothing. For what could the damned really have to say to the damned?
answer: You found nothing?

question: Peasant rumors, superstitions about garlic, crosses, stakes in the hear, all that - how do you say again? Bull shit. But one of our kind? Not a whisper.
answer: No vampires in Transylvania? No Count Dracula?

question: Fictions, my friend. The vulgar fictions of a demented Irishman... So we repaired to Paris... I think the very name of Paris brought a rush of pleasure to me that was extraordinary. I was a Creole, after all and Paris was the mother of New Orleans, a universe whole and entire unto herself... We were alive again. We were in love and so euphoric was I that I yielded to her every desire...
answer: By a large gilt mirror, in her new clothes. She is covered with jewelry, fixing earrings to her ears. Help me, mon chere... How do I look?

question: Still my beautiful child.
answer: A beautiful child! Is that what you still think I am?

question: Yes...
answer: Why do you turn away? Why don't you look. You want me to be your daughter forever, don't you?

question: Yes.
answer: Well tell me, papa. What was it like making love? You don't remember? Or you never knew.

question: It was something hurries...and seldom savored... something acute that was quickly lost. It was the pale shadow of killing.
answer: But how will I ever know, Louis? I'll never find them, will I? My own kind... Have I anything in common with her, Louis? Or her, or her - or any of them?

question: Claudia, you torture yourself.
answer: They are ducklings, that will grow into swans. Whereas I must be the duckling forever.

question: You are more beautiful than any of them.
answer: All her dolls resemble me. Are they my kind Louis? Dolls never change either.

question: You are neither, Claudia. Now stop this - You know her?
answer: Yes. Should I take her, Louis? Among her dolls? make a doll of her in turn?

question: Remember what I've told you. They'll have different powers. They'll read your thoughts if you allow it.
answer: But this can't be real. This is nonsense.

question: Nonsense all right. But something tell me it's going to be the strangest nonsense we've ever seen.
answer: Mortals, mortals everywhere. And lots of drops to drink.

question: They are here. I know they are. Listen for something that doesn't make a sound. It's a vampire. It's the one I saw in Rue St Jacques. They use no paint. And the audience think it is paint.
answer: How devilishly clever. She's no vampire.

question: We all die. Death is the one thing you share with all those here.
answer: But I'm young...

question: Death is no respecter of age. He can come any time, any place. Need I tell you what fate has in store for you?
answer: I would take my chance. Let me go! Please...

question: Just as this flesh is pink now, it will turn grey and wrinkle with age.
answer: Let me live, please. I don't care.

question: Then why should you care if you die now? Draws near her cheek. And suppose death had a heart to love and to release you? To whom would he turn his passion? Would you pick a person from the crowd there? A person to suffer as you suffer? You wait your turn. Well, have you a sister, a mother, a daughter you would send in your place?
answer: Shakes her head. She is helpless.

question: Monstrous.
answer: Yes, and very beautiful.

question: Your lips, they didn't move.
answer: They did, but too fast for you to see them. No magic, just grace and speed. He wants you... Disappointing, isn't it? To come so far and find so little. Jaded ingenues, amusing themselves with make- believe...

question: We had feared we were the only ones...
answer: But how did you come into existence? You don't want to answer... Two vampires from the new world, come to guide us into the new era as all we love slowly rots and fades away.

question: Are you the leader of this group?
answer: If there were a leader, I would be the one.

question: So you have the answers...
answer: Ah! You have questions?

question: What are we?
answer: Nothing if not vampires...

question: Who made us what we are?
answer: Surely you know the one who made you...

question: But the one who made him, who made the one who made him, the source of all this evil...
answer: That is a picture, nothing more.

question: You mean we are not children of Satan?
answer: No. I understand. I saw you in the theatre, your suffering, your sympathy for that girl. I saw you with the boy. You die when you kill, you feel you deserve to die and you stint on nothing. But does that make you evil? Or, since you comprehend what you call goodness, does it not make you good?

question: Then there is nothing.
answer: Perhaps... And perhaps this is the only real evil left...

question: Then God does not exist...
answer: I have not spoken to him...

question: And no vampire here has discourse with God or the Devil?
answer: None that I've ever known. I know nothing of God or the Devil, I have never seen a vision nor learnt a secret that would damn or save my soul. And as far as I know, after four hundred years I am the oldest living vampire in the world.

question: My God... So it's as I always feared. Nothing, leading to nothing.
answer: You fell too much. So much you make me feel... The one who made you should have told you this. The one who left the old world for the new...

question: He knew nothing. He just didn't care.
answer: Knew? You mean he is...

question: The place was dark as we left, a darkness that confounded even Claudia. And as we blundered through it, again came the thought
answer: How did you wrong him?

question: You read my thoughts?
answer: You said a name -

question: A name I don't want to say again.
answer: I seemed to recognize it... There is but one crime among us vampires here. You should know, who are so secretive about the vampire who made you.

question: Aaaah! I was so afraid it was to be born like Venus out of the foam, as we were! Come Louis, let's go! I loathe them! I can't stand the sight of them! Stupid bourgeois Parisians, all dressed in black like some private club! I've searched for them the world over and I despise them!
answer: What danger?

question: I can feel it from them! They want to know who made us, what became of him. They have their rules, their idiotic rules!
answer: Do you think I would let them harm you?

question: No, you would not, Louis. Danger hold you to me.
answer: Love holds you to me. And we are in danger, not you.

question: Love? You would leave me for Armand if he beckoned you.
answer: Never.

question: He wants you as you want him. He's been waiting for you. He wants you for a companion. He bides his time that place. he finds them as dull and lifeless as we do.
answer: That's not so.

question: Do you know what his soul said to me without saying a word? When he put me in that trance...
answer: So you felt it too!

question: Let him go, he said. Let him go. Is that what I should do Louis? Let you go? My father? My lover? My Louis, who made me?
answer: He can protect us, Claudia.

question: I was waiting for you...
answer: Listen to me. Claudia is dear to me. My... daughter.

question: Your lover.
answer: No, my beloved, my child.

question: If you say so. You are innocent.
answer: I'm not innocent. But I'm afraid. She feels she's in danger from the others.

question: She is.
answer: But why?

question: I could give you reasons. Her silence. Her youth. It's forbidden to make so young, so helpless, that cannot survive on its own.
answer: Then blame the one who made her...

question: Did you kill this vampire who made you both? Is that why you won't say his name? Santiago thinks you did.
answer: We want no quarrel with him.

question: It's already begun. If you want to save her, send her away.
answer: Then I leave too.

question: So soon? Without any of those answers you so longed for?
answer: You said there were none.

question: But you asked the wrong questions. Do you know how few vampires have the stamina for immortality? How quickly they perish of their own will.
answer: We can do that?

question: You would never give up life. If the world were reduced to one empty cell, on fragile candle, you stay alive and study it. You see too clearly. You see too much.
answer: That's what the one who made me said.

question: How he must have loved you. Louis, I need you more than he ever did. I need a link with this century. The world changes. We do not. Therein lies the irony that ultimately kills us. I need you to make contact with this age.
answer: He? Don't you see? I'm not the spirit of any age! I'm at odds with everything and always have been! I'm not even sure what I am!

question: But Louis, that is the very spirit of your age. The heart of it. You fall from grace has been the fall of a century.
answer: And the vampires of the Theatre?

question: Like moths around the candle of the age. Decadent, useless. They can't reflect anything. But you do. You reflect its broken heart. Are these not the answers you came for?
answer: Yes... My God...

question: A vampire with a human soul. An immortal with a mortal's passion. You are beautiful, my friend. Lestat must have wept when he made you -
answer: Lestat! You knew Lestat!

question: Yes I knew him. Knew him well enough not to mourn his passing. But you must go now. You must get her safely out of Paris. No-one else knows of this door. When you knock you will find me waiting...
answer: I felt a kind of peace at last. I had found the teacher which Lestat could never, I knew now, have been. I knew knowledge would never be withheld by Armand. It would pass through him as through a pane of glass. And I knew Claudia must leave me...

question: You have found your new companion, Louis! You will make me mine!
answer: How do we seem to you? Do you think us beautiful, magical, our white skin, our fierce eyes? Drink, you ask me! Have you any idea of the thing you will become?

question: Your evil is that you cannot be evil! And I will suffer for it no longer!
answer: Don't make me, Claudia! I cannot do it!

question: Yet you could do it to me! Snatching me from my mother's hands like two monsters in a fairy-tale! Couldn't you have waited? Six more years and I would have had that shape! And now you weep! You haven't tears enough for what you've done to me. You give her to me! Do this before you leave me! Oh God! I love you still, that's the torment of it. But you know I must leave you Louis...
answer: Yes...

question: And who will care for me my love, my dark angel, when you are gone?
answer: You promise to care for her then?

question: You promise to care for her then?
answer: Yes...

question: And you know what you ask for?
answer: Yes.

question: What do you think she is, Madeleine? A doll?
answer: A child who can't die...

question: And the child who did die?
answer: My daughter...

question: Look at the gaslight. Don't take your eyes off it. You will be drained to the point of death, but you must stay alive. Do you hear me?
answer: Yes!

question: Louis!
answer: She is dying. It happened to you too, but your child's mind can't remember.

question: But if she dies...
answer: It's only mortal death. Bear me no ill will, my love. We are now even.

question: What do you mean?
answer: What died tonight inside that room was not that woman. It will take her many nights to die, perhaps years. What has died in that room tonight is the last vestige in me of what was human.

question: You can make no demands here! Buffoon! Bastard -
answer: Dressed beautifully, but horribly scarred now, from the fire as well as the earlier stabbing. Lestat is confused, ancient, teetering, reaching for Santiago's shoulder to steady himself. Louis...

question: Is he the one?
answer: No, the child. The child was the one...

question: They've fooled you, Lestat! You must reach Armand! Armand has the power! Claudia!!!
answer: Above him, reaching down to take his hand. Hurry. Don't make a sound.

question: Where is she? Where's Claudia?
answer: Follow me - that way - through my cell -

question: Not without Claudia. Where is she?
answer: I can't save her.

question: You can't believe I'd leave without her. Armand! You must save her! You have no choice.
answer: Louis, I can't save her. I will only risk losing you -

question: CLAUDIA!!!
answer: I couldn't prevent it.

question: I don't believe you. I do not have to read your soul to know that you lie.
answer: Louis, they cannot be brought back. There are some things that are impossible, even for me.

question: You let them do it. You held sway over them. They feared you. You wanted it to happen.
answer: Louis, I swear I did not.

question: You didn't even warm them, did you?
answer: No.

question: And yet you knew what I would do.
answer: I knew. I rescued you, didn't I? From the terrible dawn.

question: You were their leader. They trusted you.
answer: You made me see their failings, Louis. You made me look at them with your eyes. Your melancholy eyes...

question: What a pair we are. We deserve each other, don't we?
answer: We are a pair, and that's what counts.

question: He hadn't even been there. And all those years I thought he was dead.
answer: I'm so glad you're here Louis... I've dreamed of your coming...

question: Don't try to speak... it's alright...
answer: I didn't mean to let them do it... that Santiago, he tricked me...

question: That's all past, Lestat.
answer: Yes. Past... she should never have been one of us... Still beautiful Louis. You always were the strong one.

question: Don't fear me, Lestat. I bring you no harm.
answer: You've come back to me, Louis? You've come again to me?

question: It's only a siren...
answer: I can't bear it Louis! The machines out there, that fly and that roar! And such lights! They make the night brighter than the day!

question: And they frighten you?
answer: You know I love the dark. But there's no dark anymore.

question: It's false light, Lestat. It can't harm you...
answer: If you stayed with me Louis, I could venture out... little by little... become the old Lestat.

question: I have to go now Lestat...
answer: You remember how I was, Louis.. the vampire Lestat...

question: Yes. I remember...
answer: I tried to tell you Louis... that night in Paris... when I first came to you... no-one can refuse the dark gift, Louis... not even you.

question: I tried...
answer: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.

question: You have it...
answer: You'll come back, Louis... take me out... little by little... and maybe I'll be myself again...

question: Yes, Lestat... And my story ends there. But in fact it ended a long time ago, with Claudia's ashes in that theatre. My love died with her. I never really changed after that. What became of Lestat I have no idea. I go on, night after night. I feed on those who cross my path. But all my passion went with her yellow hair. I ma a spirit with preternatural flesh. Detached. unchangeable. Empty.
answer: No... it can't end like that...

question: But it has. There is no more to tell.
answer: But you talk about passion, about longing, about things I'll never know in my life! It's still inside you, in every syllable you speak! And then you tell me it ends like that? Just empty?

question: It's over, I'm telling you...
answer: You need a new passion, Louis, a new reason to feel... what a story you've told, you don't understand yourself.

question: Do what you want with it. Learn what you can. Give the story to others.
answer: You have another chance, Louis. Take me! Give me your gift, your power...

question: Is this what you want? You ask me for this after all I've told you?
answer: If I could see what you've seen, feel what you've felt I wouldn't let it end like this! You need a like to the world out there, a connection... then it won't end like this... You need me.

question: Dear God. I've failed again, haven't I?
answer: No...

question: Don't say anymore. The reels are still turning. I have but one chance to show you the meaning of what I've said. You like it? You like being food for the immortals? You like dying? Is it beautiful? Is it intense?
answer: No... please...

question: Thank God.
answer: Louis... Louis... Holy shit... Jesus...
